subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A link with Chris Moon
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Wierd how no one seems to be able to make them work! I would like it to work 
for anyone. If anyone building this stuff needs any help, just ask. It does 
take a scope so you can see what the signal levels are doing, and how much 
DC offset there is. The DC offset problem tends to swamp out the white noise 
so no random voltage is produced. I tried to compenate wth off set 
adjustment pots, but that doesn't solve the problem, but it works most of 
the time. The off set starts at the output of the white noise transistor, 
and kinda propogates through the system, the coupling caps acutally making 
the problem worse.

Frank
